runs.comm: on the spot immediately, McCullum stays back to drop the ball on the leg side, but can't find space in a tight fielding ring
nipping in off the seam a touch to strike the thigh pad, but another good, straight length ball from Bresnan
McCullum comes down the pitch this time, but Bresnan sees him coming and bangs in the bumper, the batsman ducks beneath it
down the pitch again! McCullum comes charging down, head up, eyes closed, and not surprisingly he hits fresh air
full toss, clipped to mid on and they sprint through for one
length, pitching off and angling across Ryder, who watches it go past
very full and wide first ball, McCullum doesn't miss out on those - hitting up and over the off side for the first boundary of the game. Too easy
angling into the hip and tucked just wide of short fine leg to rotate the strike
slipping leg side to the left-hander too, and the ball strikes the pad, bobbling to leg as they scamper through. No swing whatsoever for Sidebottom
Sidebottom is targeting the batsmen's legs for some reason - this one is too far down though, so that's one for the extras column
that's better! Sidebottom finds a great line, pitching off and nipping away ever so slightly to beat McCullum's shaky defensive prod
down the pitch and muscled into the covers, but McCullum can't quite find the timing to get that away. Good intent though
fuller, on off stump and Ryder drives watchfully to point
McCullum is using his feet almost every other ball, as he does this time, giving himself some room too to scythe this over extra cover's head
down the wicket again, Bresnan responds by sending it in fuller but the batsman is equal to it, threading the gap between cover and extra with a thunderous drive
stays back this time to flick a straightish length ball behind square on the leg side
Ryder opens the face on this one to send it down to third man
bouncer from Bresnan! McCullum wasn't expecting that, he had come forward and took his eyes off it as the ball whizzed past his grille
another short ball - not as short as the previous one mind - and McCullum sends it out to the square leg fielder with a front foot pull
he finds a touch of movement in to the right-hander with his first ball, striking McCullum on the pad and they run through for a leg bye
Ryder gives himself some room and slaps a full ball into the covers, but straight to the fielder
again backing away, and Broad followed him with a back of a length delivery, tucking him up for room and just beating the edge of an angled bat

well, he's picked up a boundary but Ryder wasn't at all in control of that shot. It was full and he went to drive, but didn't get to it, taking the bottom hand off as the ball looped up and over cover and just rolled over the ropes
Ryder's got a one-track mind here, again backing away to a full ball and this time he hits it straight to mid off all along the ground
no surprise, Ryder backs away and mis-times an ugly heave over the covers. He's got enough on it to find the boundary again though, so good over for New Zealand!
utterly agricultural from McCullum, heaving across the line as the ball strikes the inside edge and dribbles meekly to the leg side. No run for a lot of effort...
dropped! McCullum charged down the track, sending the ball back to Bresnan above head height. He got a finger to it, almost parrying it to Broad at mid off. A very hard chance goes begging though
Ryder exposes his stumps and attempts some sort of paddle-heave to leg. Bresnan sends down a slower cutter though, which nips between the batsman and the stumps on its way to Kieswetter

gone this time! Ryder never really looked like scoring many today, and he's been undone by another slower cutter from Bresnan. The ball was full and Ryder lined up another nothing swipe across the line to leg with all three stumps exposed. Bowled!
Bresnan hits a length, and a heavy ball strikes the splice and goes into the off side
back of a length this time and dabbed down to third man. Sidebottom lumbers round to cut it off
back of a length, the batsman shapes to tuck it to leg but can't get bat on it. They run a leg bye
attempted guide down to third man, but ball beats bat

horrid cricket all round! Bad shot from Redmond loops up but falls short of third man, who mis-fields, the batsmen start running around in confusion, and Broad can't hold on to the return throw to complete an easy run-out!
cutter from Broad, but angled too far down leg
McCullum tries to force down to third man, the ball strikes the inside edge though, and Kieswetter sprints forward to deny any thought of a run
short and pulled, baseball-style, in the air down to long on for an aesthetically-disappointing but effective boundary
bad ball, short and angling down leg, but McCullum can't get it away with a swivel-pull, and short fine leg cuts off the shot
Redmond gets down on one knee to sweep out to the fielder on the boundary at square leg
on the spot from Swann, and McCullum stretches forward to defend
swept again out to square leg, and they amble through for one
full and tucked just wide of midwicket for a single
McCullum dances down the track and heaves mightily, but in the end is lucky to get a little inside edge, which bobbles off the boot and they run one
pushed wide of midwicket on the leg side for another single
spears one in from round the wicket, tucking Redmond up
too straight, driven down to long on
well-swept, hit very hard but Morgan sprints round to cut it off
swiped across the line down to long on
another cracking sweep, right out the middle to send the ball to Morgan's left this time, but he's quick across the turf to cut it off
swept again, this time he sends it straight out to the fielder so it'll just be one, and McCullum keeps strike
just a touch too short from Swann, and the batsman rocks back to pull out to the sweeper on the boundary
great fielding from Broad on the boundary! He ran across and tapped the ball back into play after the batsman had gone for a lofted slog-sweep. Saved two runs there
heaved straight to the midwicket fielder
another slog sweep, and he's middled this one! Redmond got a great connection on that one to send the ball sailing over Broad's head at deep square leg
swiped across the line once again, but doesn't connect this time

great fielding again from Broad! Redmond went for the slog sweep once again, Broad was right on the ropes, and leapt forward to take the catch. He showed great awareness of the boundary line, keeping his knees bent as he took the catch adjacent to the boundary marker to make sure not to touch it.
slapped straight to the close midwicket fielder
full again from Yardy, and driven down to long on this time
swept out to the deep square leg fielder
speared in at the legs, and clipped to the midwicket fielder again
Taylor walks across his stumps this time to change the angle, working the ball out to long on
McCullum sweeps out to the fielder in the deep to collect one more
not swept this time, driven hard down to long on to rotate the strike
slower from Swann - flighty, loopy delivery which turned in a touch and Taylor was too soon into the shot, hitting uppishly to leg but wide of any fielders

a vital wicket falls! McCullum went for the big heave to midwicket after taking a couple of steps down the track. He seemed to have got a good connection, but there was more height than distance in the shot and Lumb steadied himself underneath the chance to take a good, safe catch. New Zealand's middle order could struggle to assert themselves from this position...
too much width, and chopped into the off side for a single
flighted from Swann, Styris shuffles across to nudge a single behind square on the leg side
straight again from Swann, and Taylor turns his wrists over the shot to find the gap at midwicket
too far down leg, and the batsman gets a touch on it to collect a single wide of the man at short fine
wide of off this time, and Styris is content to just open the face and collect a run behind square on the off side this time
much quicker from Yardy, and Taylor guides it off the face of the blade very fine, but a sprinting fielder cuts it off before the third man boundary
driven through the covers
nurdled to leg, wide of midwicket and they scramble through for another
tickled down leg, and though short fine sprints round the batsmen steal a cheeky single
Taylor goes big! A lot of bottom hand in the shot, and he middled it with a flick of his meaty wrists to pick up a valuable six runs!
and he has the sense to calmly pick up one from the next ball and keep rotating the strike after the big shot
Styris tries to emulate his partner with a hoick down the ground, doesn't time it, but luckily it's timed badly enough that it doesn't reach the fielder on the full
Swann targets the stumps, and Taylor flicks to leg for another

good running! Really put the fielder under pressure there, the ball had been hit to leg but should have been one. The fielder was a little slow coming in off the boundary though, and they took the chance to sprint through
full and straight again from Swann, and Styris drives down to long on
and that really isn't a good start from Sidebottom. Short and leg side, Styris picks the length early, shuffling across to lift the ball up and over the short fine leg fielder for a boundary
another short ball from Sidebottom, and it's a slower one as he rolls the fingers across it. Styris swivels to pull down to the fielder who is on the boundary now
on the hips, Taylor tucks to leg and finds good placement - right between the men at fine leg and square leg, and good running gets New Zealand two more
another slow cutter, again Taylor picks the gap to leg, and again they take an easy two
slightly fuller, but Taylor picks the gap between deep midwicket and long on this time, and it's two more easy runs for New Zealand. Totally risk free

close! That was quicker and Taylor tried to drop it on the off side, but was surprised by the space, the ball did bounce at his feet but went back and just bounced over the stumps. Styris called him through for a sprinted single all the same
edged! But it was a slower ball, and so the edge dropped well short of Kieswetter. It was a slow legcutter, and a good one too
length, just outside off stump, and Taylor chops hard down on the ball into the off side

Styris backs away with Broad in his delivery stride, but the bowler spots it and follows him with a sharp short ball, Styris pulls it off his face and beats a clumsy dive from Sidebottom at short fine to pick up a boundary
nasty bouncer from Broad! He was clearly riled by the fumbled fielding attempt, and sent this ball whizzing past Styris's helmet
back of a length from Broad, Styris backed away and sliced up and over third man for another boundary! There was a hint of top edge about that shot, but the runs are flowing for New Zealand now!
length, and Styris gives himself room to club the ball down the ground. He doesn't get enough on it to beat the fielder, though, and long on slides across to cut it off. Two runs the result.
speared at the pads, and nudged out onto the leg side
Styris backs away and slaps this one in the air but between the fielders in the covers. The sweeper runs round to cut it off
Taylor walks across his stumps, Yardy fires it in full and straight and it's driven down to long off. Sharp running gets them two, and thats the fifty partnership!

short, and much slower from Yardy. Taylor's eyes lit up, and he set himself to pull that all the way back to Wellington. But he was too quick on the shot, beaten by the lack of pace and the ball strikes him in the belly
drilled down to long off
hit very hard once again, but it strikes the stumps and ricochets down to long on
crunch! Sidebottom went full, and Styris set himself very deep in his crease, giving his bat a full swing to send the ball waaaaay over long on. Muscled, well and truly.
again he sets himself for the big swing, but this time the flashing blade meets fresh air
Styris backs away, Sidebottom sends down a slow, cutting bouncer, beating the attempted slash over the covers
short again, Styris didn't get any timing on the pull and the ball looped up, but fell short of all fielders and they take a run
Taylor swings wildly to leg, but meets fresh air. Sidebottom lets him know what he thinks of the shot.
well, that ball seemed to swing a touch! Perhaps some reverse... Whatever, it was full and speared at the pads, and a pad was all the batsman could get on it.
smeared through the leg side. Length from Broad, and Taylor was waiting for it. Straight out to the fielder though
chipped, and out! Styris backed away, Broad went full and the batsman went through with the lofted drive. Got too much underneath it though, and Luke Wright runs in to take a good, sliding catch.
short and pulled to leg, Collingwood - out of character - makes a complete hash of the stop though, running right over the ball and they collect an extra run
flat-batted out into the covers, but straight to Swann. They steal a run all the same
short and pulled out to deep square leg
ooh, not that time! That one's slipped out, hitting the bat above waist height, no-ball for the height.
Hopkins goes! Broad reverted back to a shorter length, legcutter and Hopkins was through with the shot too soon. The ball took the inside edge and clattered into the stumps
short and pulled out into the deep
length, tucking up the batsman, who just about gets on top of it to nurdle to leg, and they sprint through for one
short again, and slogged mightily over the midwicket boundary for a 79-metre six! All strength and timing in that shot

gone this time! Taylor was looking for another maximum - both for the team and for his own half century - and this time he was looking to hit a fuller ball over long off. But he couldn't get the requisite elevation on the shot, and the long off fielder held a regulation chance.
McCullum shuffles right across and tries to paddle to leg, but the ball strikes glove. They sprint through for a single though

comical! Vettori shuffled across, got an inside edge that went along the ground to Kieswetter. Vettori set off for the run without looking where the ball had gone, and was sent back by McCullum. Kieswetter attempted to throw down the stumps with Vettori well short but missed by yards
full and slog-swept out to deep midwicket
Vettori backs away, nudging a length ball down to short third man, and McCullum sprints through to take strike
McCullum moves right across to the off side trying to paddle-scoop, but again can't quite connect
slower ball, Vettori heaves across the line to pick up a mis-timed one on the leg side
no surprise, out comes the paddle-scoop, and they steal another run
a somewhat sloppy end to the innings, Collingwood fires in a return throw from mid off, and it's not a good throw, Bresnan can't stop it and they steal an extra run.
